questions.question: Once a Catalog Item has been requested, what mechanism determines the approvals, and tasks that are triggered in the application?

comments.content:
The correct answer is B. Flows.
In ServiceNow, Flows are used to automate processes, including determining the approvals and tasks that are triggered when a catalog item is requested. Flows allow you to define a sequence of actions that are executed automatically based on specific conditions, making it easier to manage and streamline the approval and task processes.

questions.question: Unless there are particular security requirements, what role is given to users that perform request fulfillment work?

comments.content:
The correct answer is A. itil.
In ServiceNow, the itil role is typically assigned to users who perform request fulfillment work. This role allows users to create, update, and close incidents, problems, and requests, making it essential for those involved in the fulfillment process.
In terms of fulfillment, the most crucial role is the ITIL role, from the ITSM e-book.

In ServiceNow -> sys_user_role_list :
itil : Can perform standard actions for an ITIL helpdesk technician. This is the out-of-box ''technician'' role. Can open, update, close incidents, problems, changes, config management items. Out-of-box, only users with the itil role can have tasks assigned to them
Its called the fulfiller role but the name of the role is itil
Correct is itil, fulfiller role doesn't not exist

In ServiceNow, the role given to users who perform request fulfillment work is typically the "fulfiller" role. The fulfiller role is a predefined role in ServiceNow that is designed to give users the necessary permissions to fulfill requests, such as creating and updating records, adding comments, and closing requests.
replies: there is no fulfiller role in the base system roles list. when searching in the sys_user_role table (name contains "fulfill"), no roles will be found. so C/D/E is incorrect. also, task_worker role does not exist. A is correct.

questions.question:
Your customer is a data center. They have a construction department that builds out spaces for new customers. The customer account representatives are responsible for initiating the construction requests. The guidelines are extensive for how to complete the construction request documentation.
Your customer wants the catalog to contain two items:
1. Construction request
2. Getting Started with Construction Requests
The Getting Started Item should contain a link to a Knowledge Article.
What type of item would you use to satisfy the requirement for the Getting Started Item?

comments.content:
The correct answer is C. Content Item.
A Content Item in ServiceNow is used to provide information or links to other resources, such as Knowledge Articles. In this case, since the "Getting Started with Construction Requests" item needs to contain a link to a Knowledge Article, a Content Item is the appropriate choice.
Why isn't it just D? The requirements are for 2 items - A Construction request AND a Knowledge Article link. Everyone answering C is only meeting the second requirement not the first.
replies: Ah never mind me, I didn't pay attention to that last line of the question lol. My bad.

comments.content:
From the book:
Content Items may be used for multiple purposes:
- Link to a Knowledge Base Article (policy articles, articles providing additional information about items)
- Link to catalog content (cross-references amongst catalogs)
- Link for a Module (redirect user to the same target location specified in a navigation module)
- External Content (link to public website or internal portal)

I'm not fully sure on this question tough..
Content Item is only content, but it also needs to have a request.. Then it would be Catalog Item.. as it can hold information and a request.

C is correct 
pg 64 ITSM Tokyo
I think its E, Catalog Item.

questions.question: What is an example of a good use case for an Order Guide?
answers: A. Order a set of Dishes
E. Order a case of Laundry Soap

comments.content:
The correct answer is B. Order a Custom Automobile.
An Order Guide in ServiceNow is used to streamline the process of ordering multiple related items. It guides users through a series of questions to determine which items are needed and then submits a single request that includes all the selected items. Ordering a custom automobile is a good use case because it involves multiple components and options that need to be selected and configured together.

If an order guide is bundle. A set of dishes is just one thing, predefined: a set.
In a custom automobile you will have several things to define and choose from.
And the options you have access to can be set according to the car model too
The best option for this is B, custom mobile can be an order guide since you are guided in your purchase of a custom car, where there are different forms for interiors, paintwork, etc.
ChatGPT said B is the correct one :)
Just cleared the exam and I had this question. There were 4 available options and the "set of dishes" was not there. I chose the Automobile which I think is the correct one.
Because a set of dishes is a bundle of items that you pick out. A custom automobile is one item with different options, which is just a Catalog Item.
I feel like B because you select every aspect of the custom automobile
replies: The custom automobile would probably have variables within the cat item, so wouldn't need an order guide
It would probably be easier to have a specific catalog item for each area of the car: Interior, exterior, motor, add-ons. Meaning multiple catalog items which means...order guide.

comments.content: are you sure A is the correct answer. why custom automobile can not be

p142
requested together as a part of bundle

replies: how? explain?
i think it's in the wording, order guide is used to request a bunch of stuff as part of a bundle, while a custom automobile isn't techincally a bundle (i guess), while a set of dishwasher is

questions.question: Your customer has a catalog item for Request VPN. They would like to adjust the cart layout for only the VPN item, so the Quantity field is not displayed. How would you meet this requirement?
answers: A. On the Cart Layout, Columns tab, unselect Quantity column
B. On the Catalog Item, Columns tab, unselect Quantity column
C. On the Catalog Item, Advanced View, unselect Use cart layout, select No quantity
D. On the Catalog, Advanced View, unselect Use cart layout, select No quantity
E. On the Catalog Item, Cart Layout Related List, set the Quantity record to Inactive

comments.content:
The correct answer is C. On the Catalog Item, Advanced View, unselect Use cart layout, select No quantity.
Here's why:
In ServiceNow, to adjust the cart layout for a specific catalog item so that the Quantity field is not displayed, you need to modify the settings at the catalog item level. By going to the Advanced View of the specific catalog item and unselecting Use cart layout, and then selecting No quantity, you ensure that the Quantity field is hidden only for that particular item.
In Washington, you go to Maintain Cart Layouts, select Target Type:Browser Screen => Cart Preview Screen => columns tab and deselect Quantity column.

From the book:
Change the Advanced view of the catalog item to add cart option fields to the layout. Fields to add include:
- No cart
- No quantity
- No order
- No proceed checkout
- Omit price in cart

UI Policy hides these option fields if Use cart layout is selected.

Correct.
Textbook tokyo P132.
For each item,  change the advanced view of catalog item form to add cart option fields to the layout.
-No cart
-No quantity
-No order
-On proceed checkout

B. Build report on Requested Item table, Group by Variables for Computer > Extra memory

D. Build report on Request table, Group by Variables for Computer > Extra memory
E. Build report on Catalog Item table, Group by Variables for Computer > Extra memory

comments.content: B - details are usually on RITM level not on Request and not necessarily on Task
B definitely right, D doesnt work tested on my PDI and REQ doesnt have variables attached the RITMS do

replies: memory item is actually a requested item record under related records on the request table record, if you want to know how many ordered, you should run the report on the requested items table instead, or do a new GlideRecord() query and use the .getRowCount() mehtod to get the value
I think the answer should be B

questions.question: When building multiple catalog items, which components would you evaluate for consolidation and re-use? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
When building multiple catalog items in ServiceNow, the components you would evaluate for consolidation and re-use are: A. Sets of Variables and D. Flows and Subflows.
Sets of Variables: These can be reused across multiple catalog items to maintain consistency and reduce redundancy.
Flows and Subflows: These can be designed once and reused in multiple catalog items to streamline processes and ensure uniformity in workflows.

questions.question: Your customer complains that when their users click on the Configuration Item magnifier from the Incident form, that they are overwhelmed by the volume of CIs to choose from. They want to exclude certain types of CIs from the CI lists on the Incident. Problem and Change forms. What do you recommend to your customer?
answers: A. Add a Show field to the base cmdb table: Check the Show box on those CI records they want to display; make reference qualifier to display only the CIs with show=true
B. Use the Principal CI class checkbox, to identify the CI classes that they want visible on the Incident, Problem, and Change forms
C. Create an Access control to hide the unnecessary CIs from the itil users
D. Make a show/hide UI action to show only the desired CIs to the itil users

comments.content:
To address the issue of users being overwhelmed by the volume of Configuration Items (CIs) when selecting from the Incident, Problem, and Change forms, the best recommendation is: B. Use the Principal CI class checkbox, to identify the CI classes that they want visible on the Incident, Problem, and Change forms.
This approach allows you to filter out unnecessary CIs by marking only the relevant CI classes as "Principal." This way, only the CIs from these classes will be visible in the selection lists on the forms.

From the book:
Once any class is set as a principal class, the principal class filter is automatically applied to the CI field on change, incident and problem records. This means that only CI's within a principal class can be selected on the CI field. If there are no CI Classes marked as Principal Class, then all CIs on all forms will be selectable on the CI field.

B is Correct.

If there are no CI Classes marked as Principal Class, then all CIs on all forms will be selectable on the Configuration Item field.

questions.question:
Incidents can be created and managed in the workspace, using UI layouts that are tailored to different personas, processes, and interfaces. Examples include:

• Default
• Major incidents
• Self Service
• Mobile

What are these UI layouts called in the Now Platform?

comments.content:
Answer is E.

This question seems to testing the experience of actual machine. Since the example 'Default, Major incidents, Self Service,Mobile' is in the view of incident, and ain't seen in workspace,  E trully makes sense.
Default, Self Service, Mobile, etc. makes more sense to be Views than Workspaces

If this is the real question as it is showed, then the answer, semantically, is Views (E). 
It can't be Workspace, I mean there is no Workspace called "Form Layouts", "Mobile" or "Form Design".
Instead, you do find views applied on forms with those name (default, mobile and so on). Also, you are already inside the workspace to work on incidents as per question, so it really makes no sense to choose B. Workspace.

Unless the original question has not been properly written/posted
The tailored UI layouts for different personas, processes, and interfaces in the Now Platform are indeed called Workspaces.

These UI layouts in the Now Platform are called B. Workspaces.
Workspaces in ServiceNow provide tailored experiences for different personas, processes, and interfaces, such as Default, Major Incidents, Self Service, and Mobile.
E. Views: NO.  These are saved versions of personalized forms or lists, defining which fields appear and in what order, but they do not provide the tailored, persona-specific UI layouts.
So, the tailored UI layouts for different personas, processes, and interfaces in the Now Platform are indeed called Workspaces.

questions.question: The Major Incident Management (MIM) application is linked to the Incident management process, but the records have an additional set of States. What are these MI States?
answers: C. Proposed, Received, eCAB Convened, Closed
D. New, Work in progress, Escalated, Communicated

comments.content: IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation - Vancouver / page 256
A is correct Answer Tokyo book p.273

It's A.
Although "cancelled" is not a nice wording by SN. An Incident does not get cancelt, it gets resolved one way or another.
But regarding the MIM the MI gets demoted to a normal incident and in the MIM app the state gets called "cancelled".
ITSM book Tokyo 273

From the book:
Any itil user can propose a major incident, the major incident state is Proposed. The MI manager can promote the state to Accepted or Rejected (after it has been rejected it can be proposed again). If after it has been Accepted it needs to be demoted again, the state becomes Cancelled.
A is correct, Tokyo book p. 273
A is Correct Page 90 in ROME Implementation Book

MIM state:
Proposed -> Rejected / Accepted -> Resolved / Canceled.

questions.question: If the Assignment group is empty on an incident record, what happens when an agent that is a member of multiple user groups clicks the Assign to me UI action?
answers: A. An error is displayed indicating the agent must manually assign the incident
B. The agent is prompted to select the Assignment group

D. The Assignment group field will not populate

comments.content:
B is correct
Textbook Tokyo P289
If the Assignment group is empty and you are a member of multiple groups, you are prompted to select the assignment group.

I tested it in PDI, first I had to activate the ui action since it wasn't showing on the form. Then I impersonates a user with more than one group, once I hit on the button I was taken to a previous record and with an error message. I would go then for A but I see every one confident with B

confirmed in PDI. 

bellow error message shows.
"Assigned to <username> is member of multiple groups, please select one as Assignment group"
the word "prompted" is not precie perfectly, but considering the context, It's B.
Tested on PDI and it's D

B
Using the Assign to me UI action for an incident record will follow the logic below: • If the Assignment group field is filled in and you're part of the group, the record is assigned to you.
• If the Assignment group field is empty and you're a member of a single group, the Assignment group field is filled in and the record is assigned to you.
• If the Assignment group field is empty and you're a member of multiple groups, you're prompted to select the Assignment group. When you manually select the Assignment group, the record is assigned to you.
• If the Assignment group field is filled in and you’re NOT a member of the Assignment group, an error is displayed indicating the user must be part of the Assignment group and the Assigned to field remains empty.
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation - Vancouver / page 278
Tested the same , answer is D
replies: The question is asking what UI action happens and not the behavior of the field.

comments.content: I tried this on a Tokyo PDI, it displays an error message. I tested it on the list and the workspace.
Sorry... I mean B is the right answer.

Enhancement to the Assign to me UI action
Select the Assign to me UI action for an incident record to assign the record to yourself after passing the following checks:
- If the Assignment group field is filled in and you're part of the group, the record is assigned to you.
- If the Assignment group field is empty and you're a member of a single group, the Assignment group field is filled in and the record is assigned to you.
- If the Assignment group field is empty and you're a member of multiple groups, you're prompted to select the Assignment group. When you manually select the Assignment group, the record is assigned to you.

San Diego Releases Notes - Answer C
Could be A B or D, I am leaning more towards A, because if user is member of multiple groups a Red Error Message is displayed telling user to select one as Assignment Group.

questions.question:
The key stakeholder for your ITSM implementation wants to have SLAs on every Task record.

What advice do you give regarding SLAs on Problem records?
answers: A. SLAs are essential to problem management, as support specialists need to quickly identify root causes
B. SLAs may be counterproductive to problem management, as the key objective is to permanently fix an error no matter how long that may take
C. SLAs are available for problem management, but require custom code
D. SLAs are recommended in the ITIL framework for problem management

comments.content:
B correct
LAs can be used to ensure that problems are highlighted. As investigating and fixing a problem could be a long-term effort, it is not recommended that you apply SLAs to an overall problem. SLAs are also used as a performance indicator for the Problem Management team.

Correct is B.
Service level agreements: SLAs can be used to ensure that problems are highlighted. As investigating and fixing a problem could be a long-term effort, it is not recommended that you apply SLAs to an overall problem. SLAs are also used as a performance indicator for the Problem Management team.

https://docs.servicenow.com/ja-JP/bundle/utah-it-service-management/page/product/problem-management/concept/c_ProblemManagementProcess.html
replies: correct!

questions.question:
Your customer has an external system, which is used to perform changes. Your customer wants to capture these changes in your instance for reporting and CMDB maintenance purposes.

What baseline Change Model supports this scenario?

comments.content:
The Change Registration model in ServiceNow is used to capture change requests that originate from an external system. This model is particularly useful for documenting changes made outside of ServiceNow, such as changes managed by a third-party provider or another system like Jira or GitHub.
Unlike other change models, Change Registration does not involve any approvals or workflows within ServiceNow. It's primarily used to log and track changes for reporting and CMDB maintenance purposes.
Change Registration model is used to capture change requests in an external system. There are no approvals associated with this model.

questions.question: Where are the technical approvals defined, that are executed in the Change - Normal - Assess flow?

comments.content:
A is correct.
Apply Change Approval Policy:
Controls the approval process for a change request by creating user and group approvals according to a change approval policy record. Multiple actions can be used in a flow, where each action references the same or different Change approval policies.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-service-management/page/product/change-management/concept/change-flow-actions.html

questions.question: What is the trigger for the Change - Normal - Assess Flow?
answers: A. A Change request using the Normal Change model is moved to the Assess state
B. A Change request using the Normal Change model is created
C. A Change request using the Normal Change model is Low Risk, and is moved to the Assess state
D. A Change request using the Normal Change model is Assigned to a group

comments.content: A is correct. Change - Normal - Assess is triggered when a change request using the Normal Change model is moved to the Assess state (ITSM Implementation ebook P446)
A is correct. Change - Normal - Assess is triggered when a change request using the Normal Change model is moved to the Assess state (ITSM Implementation ebook P446)

A. A Change request using the Normal Change model is moved to the Assess state
(C) is not correct as the normal Change can be (Low or Medium) Risk
I think the correct answer is D
replies: The trigger for a change request form to proceed to the assess state is based on the assignment group field. If the assignment group field is empty or not specified, the form will not proceed to the assess state
Its Assigned to field, not Assignment group.

comments.content:
A is correct
Change - Normal - Assess:Process a normal change that is in the assess state and is not on hold.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-service-management/page/product/change-management/concept/change-flows.html

questions.question:
A CAB manager is looking for a way to make their CAB meetings more organized and efficient. They want to be able to:

• Define CAB meeting agendas
• View change calendars
• Review, Approve or Reject changes directly from the change application

What feature would you recommend?
What are the Release types available on the baseline release record?
answers: B. Major, Minor, Upgrade, Emergency, Maintenance, Patch
D. Alpha, Beta, Snapshot, Nightly, Milestone, Release Candidate

comments.content:
Correct
Type of release: Major, Minor, Emergency, or Patch.

https://docs.servicenow.com/ja-JP/bundle/utah-it-business-management/page/product/enterprise-release-management/task/create-product-release.html

The correct answer is B. Major, Minor, Upgrade, Emergency, Maintenance, Patch.
These release types are commonly used in ServiceNow to categorize and manage different kinds of releases based on their impact and urgency.

questions.question: On a Normal Change Model, what are some examples of the Model State Transitions that are defined for the Authorize state?
answers: A. Authorize to Draft, Authorize to Assess, Authorize to Review
B. Authorize to Implement, Authorize to Assess, Authorize to Review
C. Authorize to Canceled, Authorize to New, Authorize to Scheduled
D. Authorize to Scheduled, Authorize to Closed, Authorize to New

questions.question: What are the components of a Flow Action?
answers: A. Inputs, Processes, Subprocesses, and Outputs
B. Processes, Subprocess and Action Steps
C. Inputs, Action Steps and Outputs

questions.question: What are key relationships between Change and Release Management? (Choose three.)
answers: A. Release management application is required, to use the Change management application
B. Change includes planning and approvals; Release includes building, testing and execution of changes
C. A Release can contain one or more Changes
D. A Change can contain one or more Releases
E. Change management provides governance, which includes Release management

questions.question: In release management, what controls the movement of the state from Scoping to Awaiting Approval?

comments.content: A is the correct option, checked on PDI
A - Manual state selection,  is correct

questions.question: What are key relationships between Changes and Incidents? (Choose two.)
answers: A. Incidents autoclose upon closure of a related Change
B. Incidents can be caused by a Change
C. A Change can resolve Incidents
D. Incident owners are part of the change approval workflow

comments.content: Dont know why I cant select both but the answers are B and C

B & C

replies: you have to select two answers

questions.question: What are key relationships between Change and Problem records? (Choose two.)
answers: A. Changes which cause Incidents, should have an associated Problem
B. A Problem can be solved by a Change
C. A Change can cause a Problem
D. A Problem must be associated with a Change, before it can be closed

questions.question:
You have just released a new Change Model to the testers. Testers report they can see the old change models, but cannot see the new change model on the change landing page.

What could cause this?
answers: A. Testers need itil role to see the change models
B. New change model needs Active to be set to True
C. New change models are only visible to Change Managers
D. Workflow has not been published

comments.content:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-service-management/page/product/change-management/task/create-a-change-model.html

B correct

Manage the users to access the change model by providing the user access in Not Available For, Available For, and Can Write tabs
-But this option is not available

questions.question: How are Features related to Products and Releases?
answers: A. Emergency releases can include products and features
B. Products have associated features, which are organized into releases
C. Features are included in releases, not associated with products
D. Products use features to define release types

comments.content: Define a planned release for a product. The content of the release is decided by the features and related requests for change that it implements.
replies: B is correct
